SEARCH
Package io.github.gorpong.hoursexport

Class Output

java.lang.Object
io.github.gorpong.hoursexport.Output
public class Output extends Object
Output class for creating the output file in Excel format. Uses the Team class/object for creating the output file. Currently uses the Apache POI (v3.17) for all of the Excel-related stuff.
Author:
Gordon Galligher - gorpong@gmail.com

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public static Output initialize(String fname, ConfigProperties cfg, double low, double hi)
      Initialize the workbook fname and create it and supplemental bits we need later. This also sets up the date values for inclusion in the Excel file and finalizes the configuration of the fonts and formats for the various cell components.
      Parameters:
      fname - The output file name (the new Excel file to create)
      cfg - The configuration object (in case we need configuration bits)
      low - The low water mark for hours that are too low
      hi - The high water mark for hours that are too high
      Returns:
      Output Factory method, creates new Output object and returns it

    • close

      public void close() throws IOException
      Write out and close the Excel file. Throws exceptions if there is an error writing or formatting the sheet.
      Throws:
      IOException - Error writing/closing file

    • getLowCount

      public int getLowCount()

    • getHighCount

      public int getHighCount()

    • fillSheet

      public int fillSheet(org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Sheet sheet, ArrayList<Student> students, Integer team, Output.SheetType type, int rowStart, int colStart)
      Fill the sheet with appropriate cells based on the team information and return the last row that was written into.
      Parameters:
      sheet - The existing Sheet object
      students - The list of people for that team (ignore sheet if null)
      team - The number of the team we are adding to the sheet
      type - The type of sheet this is (COACHES/PARENTS)
      rowStart - The starting row for the hours
      colStart - The starting column for the hours
      Returns:
      The ending row we've added into the sheet

    • createSheet

      public void createSheet(Teams teams, Output.SheetType type)
      Create the worksheet passed as type and put the data into it.
      Parameters:
      teams - The list of teams
      type - The sheet type we are to create based on enum
